justification: The analyzed package has an instability (I=1.0) that is not lower than the instability (I=0.5) of the package it depends on, 'com.google.googlejavaformat.java'. According to the Stable Dependencies Principle, it is acceptable for an unstable package to depend on a more stable one.
Depends on packages with lower stability (com.google.googlejavaformat stability 0.0, com.google.googlejavaformat.java.javadoc stability 0.0) while own stability is 0.5

The package depends on com.google.googlejavaformat.java, which has stability index of 0.5 (Ce=2, Ca=2). The analyzed package has stability index of 1.0 (Ce=1, Ca=0). Since 1.0 > 0.5, the analyzed package is more unstable than its dependency, which follows the Stable Dependencies Principle.
The package has no outgoing dependencies (Ce=0), therefore there are no dependencies on less stable components.
The package has no outgoing dependencies (Ce=0), thus it does not depend on any less stable components.
